info.title: Business Partner Data Management Pool
info.description: Service that manages and shares business partner data with other CatenaX services

tags.name: Changelog Controller
tags.description: Read change events of business partner data

tags.name: Legal Entity Controller
tags.description: Read, create and update business partner of type legal entity

tags.name: Metadata Controller
tags.description: Read and create supporting data that is referencable in business partner data

tags.name: Site Controller
tags.description: Read, create and update business partner of type site

tags.name: Address Controller
tags.description: Read, create and update business partner of type address

get.summary: Get page of sites matching the pagination search criteria
get.description: This endpoint retrieves all existing business partners of type sites.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of business partners matching the search criteria, may be empty

put.description: Update existing business partner records of type site referenced via BPNS. The endpoint expects to receive the full updated record, including values that didn't change.

200.description: Update sites request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

post.summary: Creates a new site
post.description: Create new business partners of type site by specifying the BPNL of the legal entity each site belongs to. If the legal entitiy cannot be found, the record is ignored.For matching purposes, on each record you can specify your own index value which will reappear in the corresponding record of the response.

200.description: New sites request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

get.summary: Get page of sites matching the pagination search criteria
get.description: This endpoint retrieves all existing business partners of type sites.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of business partners matching the search criteria, may be empty

put.description: Update existing business partner records of type site referenced via BPNS. The endpoint expects to receive the full updated record, including values that didn't change.

200.description: Update sites request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

post.summary: Creates a new site
post.description: Create new business partners of type site by specifying the BPNL of the legal entity each site belongs to. If the legal entitiy cannot be found, the record is ignored.For matching purposes, on each record you can specify your own index value which will reappear in the corresponding record of the response.

200.description: New sites request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

get.summary: Returns legal entities by different search parameters
get.description: This endpoint tries to find matches among all existing business partners of type legal entity, filtering out partners which entirely do not match and ranking the remaining partners according to the accuracy of the match.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of business partners matching the search criteria, may be empty

400.description: On malformed search or pagination request

put.description: Update existing business partner records of type legal entity referenced via BPNL. The endpoint expects to receive the full updated record, including values that didn't change.

200.description: Update legal entities request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

post.summary: Creates a new legal entity
post.description: Create new business partners of type legal entity. The given additional identifiers of a record need to be unique, otherwise they are ignored. For matching purposes, on each record you can specify your own index value which will reappear in the corresponding record of the response.

200.description: New legal entities request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

get.summary: Returns legal entities by different search parameters
get.description: This endpoint tries to find matches among all existing business partners of type legal entity, filtering out partners which entirely do not match and ranking the remaining partners according to the accuracy of the match.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of business partners matching the search criteria, may be empty

400.description: On malformed search or pagination request

put.description: Update existing business partner records of type legal entity referenced via BPNL. The endpoint expects to receive the full updated record, including values that didn't change.

200.description: Update legal entities request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

post.summary: Creates a new legal entity
post.description: Create new business partners of type legal entity. The given additional identifiers of a record need to be unique, otherwise they are ignored. For matching purposes, on each record you can specify your own index value which will reappear in the corresponding record of the response.

200.description: New legal entities request was processed successfully, possible errors are returned

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: OK
OK

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: OK
OK

get.summary: Returns addresses by different search parameters
get.description: This endpoint tries to find matches among all existing business partners of type address, filtering out partners which entirely do not match and ranking the remaining partners according to the accuracy of the match. The match of a partner is better the higher its relevancy score.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of addresses matching the search criteria, may be empty

400.description: On malformed search or pagination request

put.description: Update existing business partner records of type address referenced via BPNA. The endpoint expects to receive the full updated record, including values that didn't change.

200.description: The successfully updated records, possible errors are returned

post.summary: Creates a new address
post.description: Create new business partners of type address by specifying the BPN of the parent each address belongs to. A parent can be either a site or legal entity business partner. If the parent cannot be found, the record is ignored.For matching purposes, on each record you can specify your own index value which will reappear in the corresponding record of the response.

200.description: New business partner record successfully created, possible errors are returned

get.summary: Returns addresses by different search parameters
get.description: This endpoint tries to find matches among all existing business partners of type address, filtering out partners which entirely do not match and ranking the remaining partners according to the accuracy of the match. The match of a partner is better the higher its relevancy score.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of addresses matching the search criteria, may be empty

400.description: On malformed search or pagination request

put.description: Update existing business partner records of type address referenced via BPNA. The endpoint expects to receive the full updated record, including values that didn't change.

200.description: The successfully updated records, possible errors are returned

post.summary: Creates a new address
post.description: Create new business partners of type address by specifying the BPN of the parent each address belongs to. A parent can be either a site or legal entity business partner. If the parent cannot be found, the record is ignored.For matching purposes, on each record you can specify your own index value which will reappear in the corresponding record of the response.

200.description: New business partner record successfully created, possible errors are returned

get.summary: Returns all legal forms
get.description: Lists all currently known legal forms in a paginated result

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of existing legal forms, may be empty

post.summary: Creates a new legal form
post.description: Create a new legal form which can be referenced by business partner records. The actual name of the legal form is free to choose and doesn't need to be unique. The technical key can be freely chosen but needs to be unique for the businessPartnerType as it is used as reference by the business partner records. A recommendation for technical keys: They should be short, descriptive and use a restricted common character set in order to ensure compatibility with older systems.

200.description: New legal form successfully created

409.description: Legal form with specified technical key already exists

get.summary: Returns all legal forms
get.description: Lists all currently known legal forms in a paginated result

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Page of existing legal forms, may be empty

post.summary: Creates a new legal form
post.description: Create a new legal form which can be referenced by business partner records. The actual name of the legal form is free to choose and doesn't need to be unique. The technical key can be freely chosen but needs to be unique for the businessPartnerType as it is used as reference by the business partner records. A recommendation for technical keys: They should be short, descriptive and use a restricted common character set in order to ensure compatibility with older systems.

200.description: New legal form successfully created

409.description: Legal form with specified technical key already exists

post.summary: Returns legal entities by different search parameters
post.description: Search legal entity partners by their BPNLs. The response can contain less results than the number of BPNLs that were requested, if some of the BPNLs did not exist. For a single request, the maximum number of BPNLs to search for is limited to ${bpdm.bpn.search-request-limit} entries.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Found legal entites

400.description: On malformed request parameters or if number of requested bpns exceeds limit

post.summary: Returns legal entities by different search parameters
post.description: Search legal entity partners by their BPNLs. The response can contain less results than the number of BPNLs that were requested, if some of the BPNLs did not exist. For a single request, the maximum number of BPNLs to search for is limited to ${bpdm.bpn.search-request-limit} entries.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: Found legal entites

400.description: On malformed request parameters or if number of requested bpns exceeds limit

get.summary: Returns all identifier types filtered by business partner type and country.
get.description: Lists all matching identifier types including validity details in a paginated result

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

schema.description: Specifies if an identifier type is valid for legal entities (L) or addresses (A). Sites (S) are not supported.

200.description: Page of existing identifier types, may be empty

post.summary: Creates a new identifier type
post.description: Create a new identifier type (including validity details) which can be referenced by business partner records. Identifier types such as BPN or VAT determine with which kind of values a business partner can be identified with. The actual name of the identifier type is free to choose and doesn't need to be unique. The technical key can be freely chosen but needs to be unique for the businessPartnerType as it is used as reference by the business partner records. A recommendation for technical keys: They should be short, descriptive and use a restricted common character set in order to ensure compatibility with older systems.

200.description: New identifier type successfully created

409.description: Identifier type with specified technical key already exists

get.summary: Returns all identifier types filtered by business partner type and country.
get.description: Lists all matching identifier types including validity details in a paginated result

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

schema.description: Specifies if an identifier type is valid for legal entities (L) or addresses (A). Sites (S) are not supported.

200.description: Page of existing identifier types, may be empty

post.summary: Creates a new identifier type
post.description: Create a new identifier type (including validity details) which can be referenced by business partner records. Identifier types such as BPN or VAT determine with which kind of values a business partner can be identified with. The actual name of the identifier type is free to choose and doesn't need to be unique. The technical key can be freely chosen but needs to be unique for the businessPartnerType as it is used as reference by the business partner records. A recommendation for technical keys: They should be short, descriptive and use a restricted common character set in order to ensure compatibility with older systems.

200.description: New identifier type successfully created

409.description: Identifier type with specified technical key already exists

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: The specified changelog entries

404.description: No business partner found for specified bpn

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page to get results from

200.description: The specified changelog entries

404.description: No business partner found for specified bpn

post.summary: Returns a list of identifier mappings of an identifier to a BPNL/A/S, specified by a business partner type, identifier type and identifier values
post.description: Find business partner numbers by identifiers. The response can contain less results than the number of identifier values that were requested, if some of the identifiers did not exist. For a single request, the maximum number of identifier values to search for is limited to ${bpdm.bpn.search-request-limit} entries.

200.description: Found bpn to identifier value mappings

400.description: On malformed request parameters or if number of requested bpns exceeds limit

post.summary: Returns a list of identifier mappings of an identifier to a BPNL/A/S, specified by a business partner type, identifier type and identifier values
post.description: Find business partner numbers by identifiers. The response can contain less results than the number of identifier values that were requested, if some of the identifiers did not exist. For a single request, the maximum number of identifier values to search for is limited to ${bpdm.bpn.search-request-limit} entries.

200.description: Found bpn to identifier value mappings

400.description: On malformed request parameters or if number of requested bpns exceeds limit

post.summary: Return BPNL/S/A based on the requested identifiers
post.description: Find business partner numbers by requested-identifiers.

200.description: Found bpn to based on the requested identifiers

post.summary: Return BPNL/S/A based on the requested identifiers
post.description: Find business partner numbers by requested-identifiers.

200.description: Found bpn to based on the requested identifiers

get.summary: Returns a site by its BPNS
get.description: Get business partners of type site by BPNS ignoring case.

200.description: Found site with specified BPNS

404.description: No site found under specified BPNS

get.summary: Returns a site by its BPNS
get.description: Get business partners of type site by BPNS ignoring case.

200.description: Found site with specified BPNS

404.description: No site found under specified BPNS

get.summary: Returns a legal entity by identifier, like BPN, DUNS or EU VAT ID, specified by the identifier type
get.description: This endpoint tries to find a business partner by the specified identifier. The identifier value is case insensitively compared but needs to be given exactly. By default the value given is interpreted as a BPN. By specifying the technical key of another identifier typethe value is matched against the identifiers of that given type.

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: Type of identifier to use, defaults to BPN when omitted

200.description: Found business partner with specified identifier

404.description: No business partner found under specified identifier or specified identifier type not found

get.summary: Returns a legal entity by identifier, like BPN, DUNS or EU VAT ID, specified by the identifier type
get.description: This endpoint tries to find a business partner by the specified identifier. The identifier value is case insensitively compared but needs to be given exactly. By default the value given is interpreted as a BPN. By specifying the technical key of another identifier typethe value is matched against the identifiers of that given type.

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: Type of identifier to use, defaults to BPN when omitted

200.description: Found business partner with specified identifier

404.description: No business partner found under specified identifier or specified identifier type not found

AddressIdentifierDto.description: An address identifier (uniquely) identifies the address, such as the Global Location Number (GLN).

value.description: The value of the identifier like "0847976000005".

AddressIdentifierVerboseDto.description: An address identifier (uniquely) identifies the address, such as the Global Location Number (GLN).

value.description: The value of the identifier like "0847976000005".

AddressPartnerCreateRequest.description: Request for creating new business partner record of type address. In general, an address is a collection of information to describe a physical location, using a street name with a house number and/or a post office box as reference. In addition, an address consists of several postal attributes, such as country, region (state), county, township, city, district, or postal code, which help deliver mail.In Catena-X, an address is a type of business partner representing the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates).An address is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to an address. An address can belong to a site. Thus, one or no site is assigned to an address. An address is uniquely identified by the BPNA.

name.description: The name of the address. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the sharing member chooses.

physicalPostalAddress.description: The physical postal address of the address, such as an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

alternativePostalAddress.description: The alternative postal address of the address, for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

bpnParent.description: BPNL of the legal entity or BPNS of the site this address belongs to.

index.description: User defined index to conveniently match this entry to the corresponding entry in the response.

AddressPartnerCreateResponseWrapper.description: Holds information about successfully and failed entities after the creating/updating of several objects

AddressPartnerCreateVerboseDto.description: Created business partner of type address. In general, an address is a collection of information to describe a physical location, using a street name with a house number and/or a post office box as reference. In addition, an address consists of several postal attributes, such as country, region (state), county, township, city, district, or postal code, which help deliver mail.In Catena-X, an address is a type of business partner representing the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates).An address is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to an address. An address can belong to a site. Thus, one or no site is assigned to an address. An address is uniquely identified by the BPNA.

bpna.description: A BPNA represents and uniquely identifies an address, which can be the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates). It is important to note that only the BPNL must be used to uniquely identify a legal entity. Even in the case that the BPNA represents the legal address of the legal entity, it shall not be used to uniquely identify the legal entity.

name.description: The name of the address. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the sharing member chooses.

physicalPostalAddress.description: The physical postal address of the address, such as an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

alternativePostalAddress.description: The alternative postal address of the address, for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

bpnLegalEntity.description: The BPNL of the legal entity owning the address.

bpnSite.description: The BPNS of the site the address belongs to.

isCatenaXMemberData.description: Indicates whether the address is owned and thus provided by a Catena-X Member.

createdAt.description: The date when the data record has been created.

updatedAt.description: The date when the data record has been last updated.

addressType.description: Indicates the address type, the legal address to a legal entity or the main address to a site, an additional address, or both legal and site address.The site main address is where typically the main entrance or the reception is located, or where the mail is delivered to.

index.description: User defined index to conveniently match this entry to the corresponding entry in the response.

AddressPartnerUpdateRequest.description: Request for updating a business partner record of type address. In general, an address is a collection of information to describe a physical location, using a street name with a house number and/or a post office box as reference. In addition, an address consists of several postal attributes, such as country, region (state), county, township, city, district, or postal code, which help deliver mail.In Catena-X, an address is a type of business partner representing the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates).An address is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to an address. An address can belong to a site. Thus, one or no site is assigned to an address. An address is uniquely identified by the BPNA.

bpna.description: A BPNA represents and uniquely identifies an address, which can be the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates). It is important to note that only the BPNL must be used to uniquely identify a legal entity. Even in the case that the BPNA represents the legal address of the legal entity, it shall not be used to uniquely identify the legal entity.

name.description: The name of the address. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the sharing member chooses.

physicalPostalAddress.description: The physical postal address of the address, such as an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

alternativePostalAddress.description: The alternative postal address of the address, for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

AddressPartnerUpdateResponseWrapper.description: Holds information about successfully and failed entities after the creating/updating of several objects

AddressStateDto.description: An address state indicates if the address is active or inactive. This does not describe the relation between a sharing member and a business partner and whether they have active business, but it describes whether the business partner is still operating at that address.

validFrom.description: The date from which the state is valid.

validTo.description: The date until the state is valid.

type.description: One of the state types: active, inactive.

AddressStateVerboseDto.description: An address state indicates if the address is active or inactive. This does not describe the relation between a sharing member and a business partner and whether they have active business, but it describes whether the business partner is still operating at that address.

validFrom.description: The date from which the state is valid.

validTo.description: The date until the state is valid.

type.description: One of the state types: active, inactive.

AlternativePostalAddressDto.description: An alternative postal address describes an alternative way of delivery for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

country.description: The 2-digit country code of the physical postal address according to ISO 3166-1.

administrativeAreaLevel1.description: The 2-digit country subdivision code according to ISO 3166-2, such as a region within a country.

postalCode.description: The alphanumeric identifier (sometimes including spaces or punctuation) of the physical postal address for the purpose of sorting mail, synonyms:postcode, post code, PIN or ZIP code.

city.description: The name of the city of the physical postal address, synonyms: town, village, municipality.

deliveryServiceType.description: One of the alternative postal address types: P.O. box, private bag, boite postale.

deliveryServiceQualifier.description: The qualifier uniquely identifying the delivery service endpoint of the alternative postal address in conjunction with the delivery service number. In some countries for example, entering a P.O. box number, postal code and city is not sufficient to uniquely identify a P.O. box, because the same P.O. box number is assigned multiple times in some cities.

deliveryServiceNumber.description: The number indicating the delivery service endpoint of the alternative postal address to which the delivery is to be delivered, such as a P.O. box number or a private bag number.

AlternativePostalAddressVerboseDto.description: An alternative postal address describes an alternative way of delivery for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

country.description: The 2-digit country code of the physical postal address according to ISO 3166-1.

administrativeAreaLevel1.description: The 2-digit country subdivision code according to ISO 3166-2, such as a region within a country.

postalCode.description: The alphanumeric identifier (sometimes including spaces or punctuation) of the physical postal address for the purpose of sorting mail, synonyms:postcode, post code, PIN or ZIP code.

city.description: The name of the city of the physical postal address, synonyms: town, village, municipality.

deliveryServiceType.description: One of the alternative postal address types: P.O. box, private bag, boite postale.

deliveryServiceQualifier.description: The qualifier uniquely identifying the delivery service endpoint of the alternative postal address in conjunction with the delivery service number. In some countries for example, entering a P.O. box number, postal code and city is not sufficient to uniquely identify a P.O. box, because the same P.O. box number is assigned multiple times in some cities.

deliveryServiceNumber.description: The number indicating the delivery service endpoint of the alternative postal address to which the delivery is to be delivered, such as a P.O. box number or a private bag number.

BpnIdentifierMappingDto.description: Mapping of Business Partner Number to identifier value

BpnRequestIdentifierMappingDto.description: Mapping of Business Partner Number to requested-identifier value

BpnRequestIdentifierSearchRequest.description: Mapping of Business Partner Number to requested-identifier value

ChangelogEntryVerboseDto.description: An entry of the changelog, which is created each time a business partner is modified and contains data about the change. The actual new state of the business partner is not included.

bpn.description: The business partner number for which the changelog entry was created. Can be either a BPNL, BPNS or BPNA.

businessPartnerType.description: One of the types of business partners for which the changelog entry was created: legal entity, site, address.

timestamp.description: The date and time when the changelog entry was created.

changelogType.description: One of the actions for which the changelog entry was created: create, update.

ChangelogSearchRequest.description: Request for searching and filtering the business partner changelog

timestampAfter.description: Only changelog entries created after this time. Ignored if empty.

code.description: The country subdivision code according to ISO 3166-2

name.description: The name of the country subdivision according to ISO 3166-2

ErrorInfoAddressCreateError.description: Holds information about failures when creating or updating an entity

message.description: Error message that explains the error

entityKey.description: Key of the entity that failed from the request object: index or BPN

FieldQualityRuleDto.description: Rule for the quality level of an entity field

schemaName.description: Schema name of the entity the field belongs to

country.description: Country for wich the rule is valid

GeoCoordinateDto.description: The exact location of the physical postal address in latitude, longitude, and altitude.

IdentifierTypeDetailDto.description: Information for which countries an identifier type is valid and mandatory.

country.description: 2-digit country code for which this identifier is valid; null for universal identifiers.

mandatory.description: True if identifier is mandatory in this country.

IdentifierTypeDto.description: An identifier type defines the name or category of an identifier, such as the German Handelsregisternummer, VAT number, Global Location Number (GLN), etc. The identifier type is valid for a business partner type.

technicalKey.description: The technical identifier (unique in combination with businessPartnerType).

businessPartnerType.description: One of the types of business partners for which the identifier type is valid.

name.description: The name of the identifier type.

abbreviation.description: The local short form of the identifier type used in particular country.

transliteratedName.description: The transliterated (Latinized) form of the name.

transliteratedAbbreviation.description: The transliterated (Latinized) form of the abbreviation.

IdentifiersSearchRequest.description: Contains identifiers to search legal entities by

idType.description: Technical key of the type to which the identifiers belongs to

LegalEntityIdentifierDto.description: A legal entity identifier (uniquely) identifies the legal entity, such as the German Handelsregisternummer, a VAT number, etc.

value.description: The value of the identifier like "DE123465789".

issuingBody.description: The name of the official register, where the identifier is registered. For example, a Handelsregisternummer in Germany is only valid with its corresponding Handelsregister.

LegalEntityIdentifierVerboseDto.description: A legal entity identifier (uniquely) identifies the legal entity, such as the German Handelsregisternummer, a VAT number, etc.

value.description: The value of the identifier like "DE123465789".

issuingBody.description: The name of the official register, where the identifier is registered. For example, a Handelsregisternummer in Germany is only valid with its corresponding Handelsregister.

LegalEntityPartnerCreateRequest.description: Request for creating new business partner record of type legal entity. In general, a legal entity is a juridical person that has legal rights and duties related to contracts, agreements, and obligations. The term especially applies to any kind of organization (such as an enterprise or company, university, association, etc.) established under the law applicable to a country.In Catena-X, a legal entity is a type of business partner representing a legally registered organization with its official registration information, such as legal name (including legal form, if registered), legal address and tax number.A legal entity has exactly one legal address, but it is possible to specify additional addresses that a legal entity owns. Thus, at least one address is assigned to a legal entity. A legal entity can own sites. Thus, many or no sites are assigned to a legal entity. A legal entity is uniquely identified by the BPNL.

legalName.description: The name of the legal entity according to official registers.

legalShortName.description: The abbreviated name of the legal entity.

legalForm.description: The legal form of the legal entity.

isCatenaXMemberData.description: Indicates whether the legal entity is owned and thus provided by a Catena-X Member.

legalAddress.description: The official, legal correspondence address to be provided to government and tax authorities and used in all legal or court documents.

index.description: User defined index to conveniently match this entry to the corresponding entry in the response.

LegalEntityPartnerCreateResponseWrapper.description: Holds information about successfully and failed entities after the creating/updating of several objects

LegalEntityPartnerCreateVerboseDto.description: Created/updated business partner of type legal entity. In general, a legal entity is a juridical person that has legal rights and duties related to contracts, agreements, and obligations. The term especially applies to any kind of organization (such as an enterprise or company, university, association, etc.) established under the law applicable to a country.In Catena-X, a legal entity is a type of business partner representing a legally registered organization with its official registration information, such as legal name (including legal form, if registered), legal address and tax number.A legal entity has exactly one legal address, but it is possible to specify additional addresses that a legal entity owns. Thus, at least one address is assigned to a legal entity. A legal entity can own sites. Thus, many or no sites are assigned to a legal entity. A legal entity is uniquely identified by the BPNL.

bpnl.description: A BPNL represents and uniquely identifies a legal entity, which is defined by its legal name (including legal form, if registered), legal address and tax number.

legalShortName.description: The abbreviated name of the legal entity.

legalForm.description: The legal form of the legal entity.

currentness.description: The date the business partner data was last indicated to be still current.

updatedAt.description: The date when the data record has been last updated.

legalAddress.description: The official, legal correspondence address to be provided to government and tax authorities and used in all legal or court documents.

Thus, at least one address is assigned to a legal entity. A legal entity can own sites. Thus, many or no sites are assigned to a legal entity. A legal entity is uniquely identified by the BPNL.

LegalEntityStateDto.description: A legal entity state indicates if the legal entity is active or inactive. This does not describe the relation between a sharing member and a business partner and whether they have active business, but it describes whether the legal entity is still operating.

validFrom.description: The date from which the state is valid.

validTo.description: The date until the state is valid.

type.description: One of the state types: active, inactive.

validTo.description: The date until the state is valid.

type.description: One of the state types: active, inactive.

LegalFormDto.description: A legal form is a mandatory corporate legal framework by which companies can conduct business, charitable or other permissible activities.

technicalKey.description: The technical identifier of the legal form according to ISO 20275.

name.description: The name of legal form according to ISO 20275.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviated name of the legal form, such as AG for German Aktiengesellschaft.

LegalFormRequest.description: New legal form record to be referenced by business partners

technicalKey.description: Unique key to be used for reference

name.description: Full name of the legal form

transliteratedName.description: Transliterated name of the legal form

abbreviation.description: Comma separed list of abbreviations of the legal form name

transliteratedAbbreviations.description: Transliterated abbreviations of the legal form abbreviations

country.description: The country to which this legal form belongs to

language.description: The language of the legal form's name

administrativeAreaLevel1.description: The administrative area level 1 this legal form belongs to

isActive.description: Whether this legal form is considered as active according to GLEIF

LogisticAddressDto.description: In general, an address is a collection of information to describe a physical location, using a street name with a house number and/or a post office box as reference. In addition, an address consists of several postal attributes, such as country, region (state), county, township, city, district, or postal code, which help deliver mail.In Catena-X, an address is a type of business partner representing the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates).An address is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to an address. An address can belong to a site. Thus, one or no site is assigned to an address. An address is uniquely identified by the BPNA.

name.description: The name of the address. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the sharing member chooses.

physicalPostalAddress.description: The physical postal address of the address, such as an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

alternativePostalAddress.description: The alternative postal address of the address, for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

LogisticAddressVerboseDto.description: In general, an address is a collection of information to describe a physical location, using a street name with a house number and/or a post office box as reference. In addition, an address consists of several postal attributes, such as country, region (state), county, township, city, district, or postal code, which help deliver mail.In Catena-X, an address is a type of business partner representing the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates).An address is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to an address. An address can belong to a site. Thus, one or no site is assigned to an address. An address is uniquely identified by the BPNA.

bpna.description: A BPNA represents and uniquely identifies an address, which can be the legal address of a legal entity, and/or the main address of a site, or any additional address of a legal entity or site (such as different gates). It is important to note that only the BPNL must be used to uniquely identify a legal entity. Even in the case that the BPNA represents the legal address of the legal entity, it shall not be used to uniquely identify the legal entity.

name.description: The name of the address. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the sharing member chooses.

physicalPostalAddress.description: The physical postal address of the address, such as an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

alternativePostalAddress.description: The alternative postal address of the address, for example if the goods are to be picked up somewhere else.

bpnLegalEntity.description: The BPNL of the legal entity owning the address.

bpnSite.description: The BPNS of the site the address belongs to.

isCatenaXMemberData.description: Indicates whether the address is owned and thus provided by a Catena-X Member.

createdAt.description: The date when the data record has been created.

updatedAt.description: The date when the data record has been last updated.

addressType.description: Indicates the address type, the legal address to a legal entity or the main address to a site, an additional address, or both legal and site address.The site main address is where typically the main entrance or the reception is located, or where the mail is delivered to.

PhysicalPostalAddressDto.description: A physical postal address describes the physical location of an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

country.description: The 2-digit country code of the physical postal address according to ISO 3166-1.

administrativeAreaLevel1.description: The 2-digit country subdivision code according to ISO 3166-2, such as a region within a country.

administrativeAreaLevel2.description: The name of the locally regulated secondary country subdivision of the physical postal address, such as county within a country.

administrativeAreaLevel3.description: The name of the locally regulated tertiary country subdivision of the physical address, such as townships within a country.

postalCode.description: The alphanumeric identifier (sometimes including spaces or punctuation) of the physical postal address for the purpose of sorting mail, synonyms:postcode, post code, PIN or ZIP code.

city.description: The name of the city of the physical postal address, synonyms: town, village, municipality.

district.description: The name of the district of the physical postal address which divides the city in several smaller areas.

companyPostalCode.description: The company postal code of the physical postal address, which is sometimes required for large companies.

industrialZone.description: The industrial zone of the physical postal address, designating an area for industrial development, synonym: industrial area.

building.description: The alphanumeric identifier of the building addressed by the physical postal address.

floor.description: The number of a floor in the building addressed by the physical postal address, synonym: level.

door.description: The number of a door in the building on the respective floor addressed by the physical postal address, synonyms: room, suite.

taxJurisdictionCode.description: Tax jurisdiction codes are used to identify the specific jurisdiction(s) that a company belong to, particularly in bureaucratic processes such as tax returns and IRS forms.

PhysicalPostalAddressVerboseDto.description: A physical postal address describes the physical location of an office, warehouse, gate, etc.

country.description: The 2-digit country code of the physical postal address according to ISO 3166-1.

administrativeAreaLevel1.description: The 2-digit country subdivision code according to ISO 3166-2, such as a region within a country.

administrativeAreaLevel2.description: The name of the locally regulated secondary country subdivision of the physical postal address, such as county within a country.

administrativeAreaLevel3.description: The name of the locally regulated tertiary country subdivision of the physical address, such as townships within a country.

postalCode.description: The alphanumeric identifier (sometimes including spaces or punctuation) of the physical postal address for the purpose of sorting mail, synonyms:postcode, post code, PIN or ZIP code.

city.description: The name of the city of the physical postal address, synonyms: town, village, municipality.

district.description: The name of the district of the physical postal address which divides the city in several smaller areas.

companyPostalCode.description: The company postal code of the physical postal address, which is sometimes required for large companies.

industrialZone.description: The industrial zone of the physical postal address, designating an area for industrial development, synonym: industrial area.

building.description: The alphanumeric identifier of the building addressed by the physical postal address.

floor.description: The number of a floor in the building addressed by the physical postal address, synonym: level.

door.description: The number of a door in the building on the respective floor addressed by the physical postal address, synonyms: room, suite.

taxJurisdictionCode.description: Tax jurisdiction codes are used to identify the specific jurisdiction(s) that a company belong to, particularly in bureaucratic processes such as tax returns and IRS forms.

regionCode.description: Abbreviation or shorthand of the area

regionName.description: Describes the full name of the region within a country according to ISO 3166-214

RelationVerboseDto.description: Directed relation between two business partners

type.description: The type of relation between the Legal Entities

businessPartnerSourceBpnl.description: BPN of partner from which the relation emerges (the source)

businessPartnerTargetBpnl.description: BPN of partner to which this relation goes (the target)

name.description: The name of the site. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the owner chooses.

SitePartnerCreateRequest.description: Request for creating new business partner record of type site. In general, a site is a delimited geographical area in which an organization (such as an enterprise or company, university, association, etc.) conducts business. In Catena-X, a site is a type of business partner representing a physical location or area owned by a legal entity, where a production plant, a warehouse, or an office building is located. A site is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to a site. A site has exactly one main address, but it is possible to specify additional addresses (such as different gates), that belong to a site. Thus, at least one address is assigned to a site. A site can only be uploaded and modified by the owner (the legal entity), because only the owner knows which addresses belong to which site. A site is uniquely identified by the BPNS.

name.description: The name of the site. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the owner chooses.

bpnlParent.description: The BPNL of the legal entity owning the site.

index.description: User defined index to conveniently match this entry to the corresponding entry in the response.

SitePartnerCreateResponseWrapper.description: Holds information about successfully and failed entities after the creating/updating of several objects

SitePartnerCreateVerboseDto.description: Created/updated business partner of type site. In general, a site is a delimited geographical area in which an organization (such as an enterprise or company, university, association, etc.) conducts business. In Catena-X, a site is a type of business partner representing a physical location or area owned by a legal entity, where a production plant, a warehouse, or an office building is located. A site is owned by a legal entity. Thus, exactly one legal entity is assigned to a site. A site has exactly one main address, but it is possible to specify additional addresses (such as different gates), that belong to a site. Thus, at least one address is assigned to a site. A site can only be uploaded and modified by the owner (the legal entity), because only the owner knows which addresses belong to which site. A site is uniquely identified by the BPNS.

name.description: The name of the site. This is not according to official registers but according to the name the owner chooses.

isCatenaXMemberData.description: Indicates whether the site is owned and thus provided by a Catena-X Member.

bpnLegalEntity.description: The BPNL of the legal entity owning the site.

createdAt.description: The date when the data record has been created.

updatedAt.description: The date when the data record has been last updated.

mainAddress.description: The address, where typically the main entrance or the reception is located, or where the mail is delivered to.

StreetDto.description: The street of the physical postal address, synonyms: road, avenue, lane, boulevard, highway

houseNumber.description: The number representing the exact location of a building within the street.

milestone.description: The number representing the exact location of an addressed object within a street without house numbers, such as within long roads.

direction.description: The cardinal direction describing where the exit to the location of the addressed object on large highways / motorways is located, such as Highway 101 South.

namePrefix.description: The street related information, which is usually printed before the official street name on an address label.

additionalNamePrefix.description: The additional street related information, which is usually printed before the official street name on an address label.

nameSuffix.description: The street related information, which is usually printed after the official street name on an address label.

additionalNameSuffix.description: The additional street related information, which is usually printed after the official street name on an address label.
